tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: alu anga puluq a cavilj na ramaljemaljeng ljakua nu tja pacunan namaya ta inika vuluvulung.
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
我今天七點到學校。: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ku kivadaq timadju pida su kinacaqu a kai macaqu aravac a ikai ta pinaiwanan saigu uta ikai ta na tjukuku zipun kilang a kai.
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in paiwan, as well as Chinese, Hakka and Japanese.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他會哪些語言，他的排灣語說得很流利，也會說中文、客家話和日本話。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ka kivadaq anga ken tjaimadju kemeljang anga aken tu na kemasi kakedriyan kitulu ta zipun a kai a valjaw nimadju pairang i tua karakudakudain nimadju tjuruvu a kineljang a kilang manasika liyaw a kinacaqu a kai.
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Chinese, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是平地人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: tazua kakiqaqivuavuan amen liyaw a sini pasemalaw a pakatua qemaljup a saiguan kata kakudan.
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: kumalji inika liyaw a niakeljange ljakua nia pinaka tua dinguwa a paiga maqati a gemalju kiljaluai a kilangeda.
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: kakakedryan aken neka nu ku kemeljang tua ku bunka masiyaq aken a maciljilj ta ku kinacalisiyanan.
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: nu cuai anga nu tjaliau a kineljangan paka pakisumalji a kinanguaq kinabulai sedjalep a sikizengel a kinapaiwanan.
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Paiwan is unique and something to be proud of.
我今天七點到學校。: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為排灣族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: tucu a qadaw nu masulem uri mangetjez anga ku kaka tjaljaljak a uqaljai.
My younger brother is going home this evening.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: vaik aken kati vuvu a vavayan a semavavelian a veneli ta djurikuku tu sipadjulu a kemesa ta sanguanguaq a kaiven tu sipakan ta ku kaka tjaljaljak a uqaljai.
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: cemalivat amen ta vaveliyan liyaw a vaquan a ljaceng.
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: na veneli amen ta ingcai qaqilj kata daikung.
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: qivu azua i ljaqedi a paveliveli ta kudamunu a tauki, “qaljemeqem aku panguralj kata qudis pai veliu tu kedri aya!”
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
我今天七點到學校。: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: na veneli amen ta panguralj kata qudis.
We bought pineapples and peaches.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: kacemalivat amen ta vavelian ta vutjulj, qivu a tauki, “anema su velin? tucu a qadaw a kuka kakudralj sa qaluman nu ita tjeluaidai.”
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: paka pazangal ti vuvu a vavayan kivadaqan a tauki maqati a menadjulu a paveli.
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ljakua qivu a tauki minamadjulu anga inika maqati a paljateku ta kakavelian.
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
我今天七點到學校。: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: a i ljaqedi a tauki qivu ta idu veliu ta ku ciqaw kudralj saka madjulu.
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: kacuai anga veneli anga men ta kuka kata ciqaw tjumaq sa kemesa tu tja nu ita cekui a djamai.
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: anga kaljava masulem anga kalevelevan.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
我今天七點到學校。: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: na palingas aku kaka tjaljaljak a uqaljai na papintjus a ikai ta ini anga maqati a pulavai a puhitayan nu tjaivililj a niciubi maqati anga tjumaq.
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
我今天七點到學校。: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ikai ti vuvu a vavayan liyaw anga kinsa qaqivu a mapuljat ta kemanan!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: na tjemaulj amen ta mareka nia kasusu qali ta meseljang a kaiv.
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: izua ku qali a ti kuliw timadju ru maraurau a kemacu ta nemanga.
I have a classmate named kuliw, he often forgets to bring things.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個朋友叫kuliw，他常常忘記帶東西。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: nu kitulutulu kisedjam ta salasaladja tua sivecivecik siquliqulip kata vavecikan a qadupu.
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: nu puita pudrusa putjelu pasedjaman timadju na zuma.
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
我今天七點到學校。: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ljakua izua za inika bulai a kakudanan nimadju ru kisedjam sa ini a nga pacikel.
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
我今天七點到學校。: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: nu cuai anga inika nga pasedjam tjaimadju.
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: izua ka ita qadaw vaik amen a mapuljat a kivangavang.
One day, we all went on an outing together.
我今天七點到學校。: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: kaidjalan lingau ti kuliw ta sama kaya ljakua na maraurau a kemacu ta sidjuadjuas.
On the way, kuliw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
我今天七點到學校。: 路途中，kuliw想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: kisedjam timadju ta cilikami tua salasaladj ljakua tevelain tjaimadju namaya ken uta a inika na kemacu.
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.
我今天七點到學校。: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: qemaung ta latjakan ti kuliw madjalw sa ikaikai aqumaya inika ken a nu pasedjaman ta cilikami aya.
kuliw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!
我今天七點到學校。: kuliw急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: pasemalavan na salasaladj timadju, ayatua inika sun a kemacu nu kisedjam sun inika su pacekel!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!
我今天七點到學校。: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: katiyau anga tu qadaw na medjama ti kuliw a magakku pacikelen a kinisedjam a nemanga na salasaladj.
The next day at school, kuliw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔天上學，kuliw很早就到學校了，kuliw把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: kipaqaljai ta salasaladj ti kuliw ikai, ta tjara kemacu anga nu tjaivililj ta nemanga timadju masalu uta ta salasaladj ta na selaing a pasedjam ta nemanga tjaimadju.
kuliw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
我今天七點到學校。: kuliw向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: a ku kama ru qaljuqaljup i qinaljap.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ka kakedriyan aken nu uri vaik a qemaljup nu qezemezemetj ti kama kati kama i kuliw kemacu ta tjakidi kata kuang.
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
我今天七點到學校。: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔kuliw會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: nu maljiya mangtjez a na kemacu ta qinaljup tiamadju.
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: izua nu vavui izua nu lava izua nu patavatan uta.
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
我今天七點到學校。: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: i ta sidjaljunan a qinaljan pangaljen niamadju ta sikataqaljan azua qinaljup a sacemel.
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: tjara makavaljai aken sakamaya tjai kama a vaik a qemaljup.
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ikai ti kama nu meqacanga ken kacuin anga sun aya.
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: saigu uta puringai ta sidjameqan ta sacemel a i qinaljan a uqaljaqaljai saigu tiamadju a semanaya ta pareqel kata kadringayan a ringai.
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.
我今天七點到學校。: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: saigu aravac a semanaya ta pareqei a ringai ti kama ikai ti kama aicu sidjamedjameq ta patjavatan tja kigagaljuin a pacun a pinakazuan a tjekap na sacemel tjapizuain i tua pinakazuan a djalan na sacemel a ringai.
My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ayatua sika maqatiyan a djaljaw a kiseljang ta ramaljeng a qemaljup kicaquan aken a ljemita qadaw ta puringai a ku ringai djaljaw a paqulid sa djemameq ta sacemel.
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: kapacun ti kama tja nu aken ikai ta nu tjaivililj tjara tjalja saiguan anga sun aya.
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: maqacuvucuvung anga ken tucu kemavuc aken ta ku panaq kata vakela a kiseljang tjai kama a vaik a qemaljup.
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: nu cemikel a maqinaljan azua qinaljup a sacemel siseljiva tua taqaljaqaljan a caucau.
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ikai ti kama maleva itjen ta tja sevalitan a na papumanguaqan sa izua mapeljuq a tja sacemel a qinaljup.
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: na sekavililj anga en a sema gaku ka kadjaman.
I was late for school this morning.
我今天七點到學校。: 我早上上學遲到了。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: na dremaudraw aen, masi kabang a semagaku.
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
我今天七點到學校。: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: neka nu anema a u kinacu.
I didn’t bring anything with me.
我今天七點到學校。: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: matevelj amen, a pacun tua sapitj a kitulutulu.
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: nu sekiseking, pasedjaman aen tua sivecivecik katua siquliqulip nua u salasaladj.
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
我今天七點到學校。: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: aitucuin aen ni sinsi, “nu tjayvililj udamau anga migacalj, mayanga sekavililj!”
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”
我今天七點到學校。: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ti Kuliu a u kaqaliyan, aljak nua sePaiwan uta timadju.
My good friend’s name is Kuliu, and he is also an Paiwan child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的好朋友叫Kuliu，他也是排灣族的小孩。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: maciyuciyur amen a kitulu i Tjaqaciljay a qinaljan.
We study together in the Tjaqaciljay tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們一起在Tjaqaciljay部落讀書。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ru kilangda men tua vuluvulung a menilimilingan, macaqu amen aravac a penaiwanan.
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Paiwan proficiently.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說排灣語。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: qaca tu kural aen, kedri tu mariljay ti Kuliu.
I am tall and overweight, while Kuliu is short and thin.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很高也很胖，Kuliu很矮也很瘦。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: tarivak aravac ti Kuliu, tjenglay amen a mapuljat taymadju.
Kuliu is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: Kuliu很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: malalumalj tua undu nua gaku kasuni a qadaw masanliyaw aravac a sipalalumalj a undu.
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: izua mavavijvilj tua calis, tjemadrek tua buru, mintuluq, zemiyan katua penanaq.
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
我今天七點到學校。: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: malalumalj ta mintuluq a masaniyaen.
I participated in the running competition.
我今天七點到學校。: 我比賽跑步。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: na sekulilj aen ka mintuluq aen, na pedjamuq tu qaca ravac a u cungal.
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
我今天七點到學校。: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ljakua migacalj aen, sa getjem a minntuluq a pasaqayaw.
But I stood up and continued running forward.
我今天七點到學校。: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ka djemaljun aen tua pautezan, maleva aravac a timaimanga caucau.
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
我今天七點到學校。: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ljaki inika en a malap tua sangasangasan, ngadan na maleva en aravac, ayatua u qinacuvung a lalumaljen.
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: na vaik amen kati ama kivala tjay ama i Sakinu.
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔(sakinu)。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: na mapasaqetju a kula ni ama i Sakinu.
My uncle injured his foot.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔(sakinu)的腳受傷了。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: tjinumaljan amen tu na maberung tu ita berung a qaljiyu.
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
我今天七點到學校。: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ka ljemelaljelay timadju tua qaliyu na matjani a kemasi tua qaljiyu.
He fell off the roof while repairing it.
我今天七點到學校。: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: na kemacu ti ama tua vutjulj a gung katua saviki tu sipavay tjay ama i Sakinu.
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔(sakinu)。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: masudju amen i qumaqan kati ama i Sakinu, pinaseljavakan aen tu liyaw a milimilingan.
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和叔叔(sakinu)在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ka uri vaik anag en ， kemazala ti ama i Sakinu tu na meqaca ngaen, tu tja vangsar anagen.
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
我今天七點到學校。: 我要離開前，叔叔(sakinu)誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: u ayain tiama i Sakinu: ‘’ nu menguaq anga su kula, pangtjezu anga matjanuamen a kivala。”
I said, When your foot gets better
我今天七點到學校。: come to our house next time and visit us.""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35149/5: 我說：「等叔叔(sakinu)腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ka2022a cavilj, na pakaigi a sihu tu maqati anga vecikan a mibunsiu tu na sekacalisiyan a ngadan.
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
我今天七點到學校。: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: u kinivala sa kivadaqi azua cuacuay anga kiqaqav tua sihu tu vecikan a mibusiu tua “na kacalisiyan a ngadan’’ a i qinaljan a ti Kuliu a maqacuvucuvung.
I interviewed Kuliu, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
我今天七點到學校。: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Kuliu。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: niapinenetj tucu sisekezan a qadaw tu uri kivalain a semata tjumaq nimadju.
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ka maljavaljavar amen pinasemalavan aen tua kinasizuan nua ngadan nimadju, pinakeljangan aen tua sikatacemkeljan katua nimadju a qinaljan.
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: “akumaya gemtjem sakamaya tu mumalj tua ngadan, manu nakuya sipavecikan a sicuayan?’’ u ayain a kivadaq.
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: aitucuin aen nimadju, “ayatua a ciniukukan a vecik inika sedjameq tua kaqulidan a ngadan nimadju, a qaliqali “ku siyenseng” ayanan nu qemaqivu tjaymadju”, liyaw ana masan djeli a kay.
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ku Xian Sheng
我今天七點到學校。: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35149/5: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「古先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: ati Kuliu qivu, “a veciken tu na kinacalisiyan a ngadan, kanimitjan angata ngadan. a u ngadan avan nu na sevalit tua nimitja tjarakacalisilisiyan, nimitja cemekeljan, na saljinga itjen tu madjumak a kanimadjuan a ngadan.”
Kuliu said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
我今天七點到學校。: our family
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35149/5: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.\""
column5: Kuliu說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: na vaik amen kati vuvau a vavayan i papaveliyan a zematjak tua racev, na kemacu tu liyaw a sinitalem a ljaceng, sa sanayai tua na kinacaliiyan a kakanen sa paseljavakan tua caucau a mapuljat.
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: tjenglay a mapuljat tua zinatjakan ni vuvu a vavayan, tjuruvu a veneli tua kamangulj katua ljaqacay, tjuruvu uta mangtjez a keman tua sinadjamay nimadju.
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
我今天七點到學校。: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: sanguaq aravac a kinsa nimadju a kuniyaw katua djuadjuay a tjinaljek, djinaung tua aradj a vutjulj nua vavay, madjaulj a tjuruvu a qaljaqalja tua sequan, matjatjavilivilj a caucau matua nia zinatjakan.
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的芋頭乾粉滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: nu kemesakesa ti vuvu a vavayan, i gidi aen a djemaudjaulj tua qaljaqalja. tjarautjautjau aen i gidi a, “niyamen a sinitalem a ljaceng, na meqca i gadu, pay kirimu a mangtjez a veneli u!”
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown
我今天七點到學校。: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/35149/5: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: palamu mapuljt a sepaveli a nia racev, maytucu ti vuvu a vavayan, “ayatua ulja izua sun na pusaladj lja.”
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""
我今天七點到學校。: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: aicu sengsengan, na matulu anagen tua na cemelanga katua kakanen a kakeljangan, autauta seljavak anga en tua luljayan nua zematjak a paveli.
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

tucu a qadaw pitju a milingan djemaljun: pacun aen tua tjenglayan nivuvu a vavayan ta sicuayan a kakanen, na miyazuan saka mapungadan a u vinarungan.
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
我今天七點到學校。: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
